comment.author: 39366602@N05
comment._content: We tend to think that creativity and imagination only belong to whatever era we happen to live in, and we forget that all human beings everywhere and at every time have had the benefit of the same inspiration that strikes us now.  Indeed, sometimes there is as much to be gained by going backward as there is by going forward.

comment.author: 12306929@N04
comment._content:
It appears to me that the expression ..."having your head screwed on straight....." is not new  ! 

 Here it appears to be straight but yet a bit loose ?  I gather that one-half turn more might suffice ! 

 Or it could also be it is already on too tight in which case one-half turn counterclockwise  might be appropriate. (Unless of course it happens to be left-handed threads ?) 

 I conclude that it is definitely not 'Bayonet'-type threading or latching unless of course if it is then some sort of birth defect may be operating here ?
